title: Conference on the Reality and Future of Pre-University Education in Syria Post-War
shortDescription: It aims to assess the effects of the war on education, and build a comprehensive vision for rehabilitating and developing the educational system through curriculum modernization, staff qualification, technology enhancement, and quality assurance, to achieve sustainable education that preserves national identity and keeps pace with the future.

fullDescription.title: Conference Goal
fullDescription.subTitle: Submitting proposals for rebuilding and developing education in Syria.
list: Evaluating and analyzing the reality of education before and during the war.
Developing strategic plans for the recovery of the educational system.
Submitting proposals for updating educational curricula and qualifying educational staff.
Enhancing the use of technology in education.
Controlling educational quality and supporting local and international partnerships.
Providing a sustainable educational environment that meets community needs and preserves national identity.

conferenceDays.title: Diagnosing the Reality and Laying the Foundations for Development
Planning for the Future and Setting Implementation Mechanisms

sessions.title: Opening Session
sessions.description:
Welcome speech (15 minutes).
Short documentary presentation on the impact of the war on education in Syria (15 minutes).

sessions.title: The Reality of Education in Syria Before and During the War
sessions.description:
Presentation of statistics on student dropout rates during the war (15 minutes).
Impact of the war on academic performance (15 minutes).
Impact of the war on school infrastructure (15 minutes).
Interventions and interactive discussion among attendees (45 minutes).

sessions.title: Proposals for the Administrative Reconstruction of Educational Institutions
sessions.description:
Presentation of successful experiences from other war-affected countries (20 minutes).
Discussion on how to apply these standards in the Syrian context (40 minutes).

sessions.title: Developing Educational Curricula
sessions.description:
Presentation of modern curriculum models from developed countries (20 minutes).
Discussion on how to adapt these curricula to the Syrian reality (40 minutes).

sessions.title: Qualifying Educational Staff
sessions.description:
Presentation of successful experiences in teacher training (20 minutes).
Discussion on how to apply these programs in Syria (40 minutes).

sessions.title: Closing Session for Day One
sessions.description:
Summarizing the outcomes of the first day.
Forming working groups for the second day to draft recommendations.

sessions.title: Enhancing the Use of Technology in Education
sessions.description:
Presentation of successful experiences in using technology in education (20 minutes).
Discussion on how to implement these experiences in Syria (40 minutes).

sessions.title: Building a System for Quality Assurance in Educational Institutions
sessions.description:
Presentation of successful models for quality assurance systems in education (20 minutes).
Discussion on how to apply these models in Syria (40 minutes).

sessions.title: Overcoming the Effects of War
sessions.description:
Strategies for school restoration and reconstruction (20 minutes).
Psychological and educational support programs for war-affected students (20 minutes).
Integrating displaced students and those who dropped out of education (20 minutes).

sessions.title: A Future Vision for Educational Development
sessions.description:
Proposals for educational development and adoption of advanced curricula (15 minutes).
Adoption of e-learning platforms (15 minutes).
Teacher qualification and competency enhancement programs (15 minutes).
Partnerships with local and international universities for teacher training (15 minutes).

sessions.title: Closing Session
sessions.description: Presentation of final recommendations and outcomes.
